mapper.insert: insert into app_student( member_id, pst_no, bas_addr, det_addr, work, gender, level) values(#{no},#{postNo},#{basicAddress},#{detailAddress},#{working},#{gender},#{level})
mapper.select: select m.member_id as no, m.name, m.email, m.tel, s.work as working, s.level from app_student s inner join app_member m on s.member_id = m.member_id order by m.name asc

select m.member_id as no, m.name, m.email, m.tel, m.created_date as createdDate, s.pst_no as postNo, s.bas_addr as basicAddress, s.det_addr as detailAddress, s.work as working, s.gender, s.level from app_student s inner join app_member m on s.member_id = m.member_id where m.member_id=#{no}

select m.member_id as no, m.name, m.email, m.tel, s.work as working, s.level from app_student s inner join app_member m on s.member_id = m.member_id where m.name like(concat('%', #{keyword}, '%')) or m.email like(concat('%', #{keyword}, '%')) or m.tel like(concat('%', #{keyword}, '%')) or s.bas_addr like(concat('%', #{keyword}, '%')) or s.det_addr like(concat('%', #{keyword}, '%')) order by m.name asc
mapper.update: update app_student set pst_no=#{postNo}, bas_addr=#{basicAddress}, det_addr=#{detailAddress}, work=#{working}, gender=#{gender}, level=#{level} where member_id=#{no}
